multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?

I have been increasingly forgetful for the past 2 years; I misplace things like keys, forget names or numbers, and recently I've been having trouble remembering what I watched on TV or read the day before.
How old are you?
I am 73 years old.
Have you noticed any changes in your mood, behavior, or ability to complete daily tasks?

Yes, I've become easily agitated when asked questions directly, and I've stopped my daily walks because I got lost one time. Also, my son has stopped me from cooking because I've left the gas stove on after use.
Do you have any family history of neurological conditions like Alzheimer's or dementia?
I'm sorry, but I don't have that information.
Have you been taking any medications, and are you currently under treatment for any other medical conditions?
Yes, I am currently taking aspirin, enalapril, carvedilol, and atorvastatin for hypertension, coronary artery disease, and hypercholesterolemia.
Final Diagnosis: Alzheimer's Disease.
